brewery.brewery_description: Midnight Brewery is a family owned and operated microbrewery located in Goochland County, VA. Midnight Brewery focuses on providing local beer enthusiasts with a variety of high quality, approachable beers. Owner Trae Cairns, a former IT professional, honed his brewing skills in the late hours after working his full-time job. Those late night date nights with barley, hops, and water instilled in him a brewing passion that eventually lead to the establishment of Midnight Brewery in 2011. The high demand for Midnight Brewery’s beers quickly lead Trae out of IT and into the brewing industry full-time, where he continues to entice the locals with his malty offerings.

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 2!
It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 20 check-ins with a photo.

user.bio: I have the liver (tolerance) of 90 year old, 90 lb. female. My delicate palate can discern grape from cherry Slurpees.

beer.beer_description: This flavorful brew named Blood Moon Bliss IPA stands for what a blood moon is all about! If you are unfamiliar with the blood moon's description, it's a phenomenon where the full moon is in a total eclipse that appears with a reddish color when hit by the sunlight. We chose this name as the blood orange that is added gives the brew itself a slight red color once poured. Isn't that fitting? We truly believe so! Blood oranges originated from Spain and Sicily as they have slight undertones of raspberry and strawberry that give this brew a fruity, sweet taste than your typical IPA with bitterness.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 25 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 6!

beer.beer_description: The deep mahogany hue of this Southern English Brown Ale is a hint of what’s in store for the drinker. Toffee and chocolate notes greet the nose and then the palate. This medium bodied brew would pair well with roast pork, hearty beef stew, or grilled steaks.

items.badge_description: They know what you want when you walk in the door. That’s right, you don’t have to wait for anyone here.

beer.beer_description: American-style porter brewed with locally sourced cascara from Roastology. Roasty with pleasant residule sweetness and just the right amount of coffee flavor complimented by subtle fig and dark fruit flavors.

Born and brewed in the heart of Rockville, VA, this Irish Red Ale is a beautiful blend of caramel malts and earthy hops. Sessionable at 5.5% ABV, and full of flavor to complement an array of cuisine. Caramel notes and a roasty finish make this well balanced beer a friend to burgers, barbeque and dessert!

user.bio: Life's too short for crappy beer.  Drink the good stuff.
Wine drinker ISO beers I like enough to finish.
Family/friends/music/festivals. Love hops! DIPAs and BA beers. But I'll try anything and just drink with the seasons!

beer.beer_description: The deep mahogany hue of this Southern English Brown Ale is a hint of what’s in store for the drinker. Toffee and chocolate notes greet the nose and then the palate. This medium bodied brew would pair well with roast pork, hearty beef stew, or grilled steaks.

Born and brewed in the heart of Rockville, VA, this Irish Red Ale is a beautiful blend of caramel malts and earthy hops. Sessionable at 5.5% ABV, and full of flavor to complement an array of cuisine. Caramel notes and a roasty finish make this well balanced beer a friend to burgers, barbeque and dessert!

Raise a toast to your New Beginning! Crisp and refreshing, this Kolsch style brew is the perfect accompaniment to your warm weather adventures. The grainy notes of Pilsner malt and noble hops is balanced by subtle pear notes and a crisp finish.
A liquid snicker doodle cookie in a cup...yeah you read that right!

“Purdy Mechanic” is a west-coast IPA brewed with Nugget and Chinook hops, and dry hopped with Simcoe and Chinook. Well balanced bitterness, flavor and aroma hops make this IPA approachable for all beer enthusiasts. Pair it with spicy fare, pizza night, or Friday night!

“Midnight Granite” is a rich, oatmeal stout. The subtle roast and smooth chocolate notes of this medium bodied brew make it a fantastic dessert beer on its own, or pair it with cheesecake or chocolate chip cookies for an extra special treat!

Our phenomenal Watermelon Lime Kolsch is made with fresh watermelons and lime to give a sweet and smooth finish when sipped. The subtle juicy flavor is our personal twist on our regular New Beginning. This classic beer style of Kolsch orginates from Cologne, Germany. The malts used are Vienna and Pilsner with a Kolsch yeast.
A strong malt backbone supports the piney, citrusy notes brought on by multiple additions of Cascade and Citra hops. A great beer to pair with weekend burgers or taco night!
Wheat ale with a touch of Virginia honey.

If you are unfamiliar with the blood moon's description, it's a phenomenon where the full moon is in a total eclipse that appears with a reddish color when hit by the sunlight. We chose this name as the blood orange that is added gives the brew itself a slight red color once poured. Isn't that fitting? We truly believe so! Blood oranges originated from Spain and Sicily as they have slight undertones of raspberry and strawberry that give this brew a fruity, sweet taste than your typical IPA with bitterness.
Dry Hopped Saison
Vanilla Stout
Chipotle Red Rye IPA collaboration with Stone Brewing Co.

Rye porter
Another Double/Imperial IPA in a recurring series from Midnight. This iteration combines high hop profile with the rich body of an Imperial level.
Rich smokey flavor with a smooth finish
First collaboration beer with the M.A.S.H. (Mentoring Advanced Standards of Homebrewing).
